title: MD
biography: Shin Sang-ok, anglicized as Simon Sheen, was a South Korean filmmaker who directed 74 films in a career spanning over five decades. He is best known in South Korea for his efforts during the 1950s and 1960s, many of them collaborations with his wife Choi Eun-hee. Shin posthumously received the Gold Crown Cultural Medal, the country's top honor for an artist.
aiSummary: Sang-Yong Shin is a government r&d excellence award specialist with an H-index of 59 at KAISTBiomedical Informatics (Member). Has been published in Current Opinion in Solid State and Materials Science, Light Science & Applications, Applied Surface Science. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
